definition: to hide/to evade/to dodge/to take shelter/to avoid (difficulties)
to hide/to dodge/to avoid
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from
dodgeball

sentences.english: The Honolulu Blue Guest Room is a cozy cool escape from the summer sun.
sentences.chinese: 檀香山藍色客房舒適涼爽，適合躲避夏日豔陽。

sentences.english: Like living in the mountains from the solitary who had every day.
sentences.chinese: 像躲避在深山老林居住的獨行者過每天。

sentences.english: Whoever flees at the sound of terror will fall into a pit;
sentences.chinese: 躲避恐懼聲音的必墜入陷坑。

sentences.english: The man jumped aside to dodge the speeding truck.
sentences.chinese: 這人跳到旁邊以躲避疾駛的卡車。

sentences.english: But then have a large number of the soldiers of qing appear, iron young tiger immediately call all fled.
sentences.chinese: 但隨即已有大批清兵出現，鐵彪立刻叫衆人躲避。

sentences.english: They blush, avert their eyes, hunch their shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 她們會臉紅，躲避目光，聳聳肩。

sentences.english: I want to play dodge ball.
The flat land gave the soldiers no cover from enemy fire.
sentences.chinese: 空曠地使軍隊無法躲避敵人的炮火。

sentences.english: The sly fox nimbly eluded the dogs.
sentences.chinese: 那隻狡猾的狐狸靈活地躲避開那羣狗。

sentences.english: But no, I will no longer run.
He could not persuade everyone see and then have a mountain to escape.
sentences.chinese: 衆人見勸他不住，於是便紛紛上山躲避往了。

sentences.english: Mr Wang acted the messenger to avoid inspection.
sentences.chinese: 王老師扮演這個信息員躲避監視。

sentences.english: A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;
sentences.chinese: 就是獅子乃百獸中最爲猛烈，無所躲避的。

sentences.english: She would hide under furniture or in a corner to avoid people.
sentences.chinese: 她常常藏在傢俱下面或者角落裏躲避人們。

sentences.english: Julia ordered as the people dodged the liquid.
sentences.chinese: 當人們躲避着那液體的時候，茱莉亞又發出命令。

to run out/to escape

to conceal oneself/to go into hiding/to take cover

to run away/to escape
to dodge/to sidestep
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
